reviews.review_msg: She's a sweet prof but its only been the first couple of classes and none of the assignments are clear or even outlined properly in the syllabus. With a course that has a lot going on with group projects, personal assignments, and exams I can already foresee this being a major headache when nothing is being explained clearly without confusion.

His lectures are hard to get through and he will go on for the full 4 hours. Lots of participation and group work. His grading criteria is practically non-existent, doesn't clearly outline what he is looking for so you and your group are left guessing. He also makes you rank your classmates/groupmates from best to worse during evaluations.

Good luck getting ahold of him. Never responds to emails and does not use Canvas. Does not post grading criteria and will not elaborate on criteria in class. If this class wasn't required I would have avoided like the plague. Macdougall loves debates and group projects. Did not learn anything from this class.

This prof doesnt reply to emails, period. To make things worse, he doesnt provide information regarding the grading criteria and what is expected. Much of the stuff during his lectures are boring and useless. People were leaving all the time and in the end theres only less than half of the class present. It was 100% self-study from the textbook.
This is an easy class, but the prof always made lots of mistakes, and no response for the emails.

He's an easy grader... HOWEVER, he doesn't give out guidelines or what's expected on multiple group projects. You have to constantly email the prof to obtain the minimum information. It's always very confusing attending his classes as he will change the class schedule randomly. He reads off the slides and doesn't send the slides to you for notes.

I understand that since all summer term courses are online, it may be difficult for the professors to adjust. However, it is extremely difficult to keep track of McDougall's documents and timeline because he emails them instead of putting them on Canvas and there is no course material on Canvas we can use. Lots of debates and class discussions.

The books that he uses to teach are the best . However I found the course material he presented in class to be extremely slow and outdated. He uses paper for everything, time is wasted on passing those papers around to justify useless points The time he spent in class does not justify the amount of knowledge I gained nor the tuition I spent period.

As the last BUS minor class, expect LOTS of talking/groupwork: weekly solo presentations, debates, group discussions & final group presentation. Michael was funny and passionate but the class avg is usually high and you have to read a ch each week! also he'll pick on you to talk all the time, so be prepared each class to talk!
Enjoyed the class and group project, it is one of the few classes where I applied what I learned in other courses. He is open to questions and seems to care about how you are doing.

His distribution for assignments are really unbalanced and the grading system is random. Be prepared to untrust any of the "feedbacks" he gave you since it didn't reflect on your real grade at all. The topics being taught are boring, which resulted in the unengaging discussions. He cares a lot about the performative effects than the content itself.
